Module jGame
Package jGame.core.entity

Class Entity

java.lang.Object
jGame.core.entity.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
EntityImpl
public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
This is the base class for all entities involved in the gameplay, weather it be players or AI. The normal implementation of an entity and its updates are based on the collision bounds of that entity.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Nuno Pereira

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      protected Entity()

    • Entity

      public Entity​(int startingX, int startingY, int width, int height)
      Creates an entity with the given width and height. Automatically sets this entity's collision bounds, which can be retrieved by getColisionBounds()
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      width - the width of the entity
      height - the height of the entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • Entity

      public Entity​(int startingX, int startingY, Sprite texture)
      Creates an entity with the given Sprite. The collision bounds are set based on the sprite's dimensions.
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      texture - the sprite to be rendered on top of the entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • Entity

      public Entity​(int startingX, int startingY, int width, int height, int speed)
      Creates an entity with the given width and height. Automatically sets this entity's collision bounds, which can be retrieved by getColisionBounds(). The default speed is overridden.
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      width - the width of the entity
      height - the height of the entity
      speed - the new speed of the entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • Entity

      public Entity​(int startingX, int startingY, Sprite texture, int speed)
      Creates an entity with the given Sprite. The collision bounds are set based on the sprite's dimensions.
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      texture - the sprite to be rendered on top of the entity
      speed - the new speed of the entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • Entity

      Creates an entity with the given width and height. Automatically sets this entity's collision bounds, which can be retrieved by getColisionBounds()
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      width - the width of the entity
      height - the height of the entity
      name - the name of this entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

      public Entity​(int startingX, int startingY, int width, int height, int speed, java.lang.String name)
      Creates an entity with the given width and height. Automatically sets this entity's collision bounds, which can be retrieved by getColisionBounds(). The default speed is overridden.
      Parameters:
      startingX - the starting x position of the entity
      startingY - the starting y position of the entity
      width - the width of the entity
      height - the height of the entity
      speed - the new speed of the entity
      name - the name of this entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • render

      public abstract void render​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Renders the entity on the screen.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object responsible for rendering
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      Graphics

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Updates the entity and readies it for rendering. Also, all CollisionListeners registered are notified if a collision happens.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      CollisionListener

    • isRenderable

      public abstract boolean isRenderable()
      Checks if the entity is currently renderable. This method is only intended to be used by the EntityManager.
      Returns:
      weather this Entity is currently renderable or not
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the entity.
      Returns:
      this entity's name
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • setUpInputListener

      protected void setUpInputListener()
      Sets up the key input listener.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • restart

      public abstract void restart()
      Restarts the player inside the game. Implementation is dependent on the client.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getComponent

      public <T> Component getComponent​(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
      Returns the component of class componentClass registered to this entity.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of component to return
      Parameters:
      componentClass - the class of the component to be returned
      Returns:
      the component of the given class
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • registerComponent

      public void registerComponent​(Component c)
      Registers a new component to this entity object. The general contract of the ECS is that only one component of each type can be registered on a given entity at all times. This is subject to change.
      Parameters:
      c - the new Component to be registered
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getColisionBounds

      public java.awt.Rectangle getColisionBounds()
      Returns the bounds of this entity in the game.
      Returns:
      the bounds of this entity
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • registerInputListener

      public void registerInputListener()
      Registers this Entity's key input listener in the GameLauncher's main window.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • removeInputListener

      public void removeInputListener()
      Removes this Enytity's key input listener in the GameLauncher's main window.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • addColisionListener

      public void addColisionListener​(CollisionListener collListener)
      Registers a CollisionListener object that will receive collision events and process them.
      Parameters:
      collListener - the collision listener to add
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      CollisionListener

    • getCollisionListeners

      public java.util.LinkedList<CollisionListener> getCollisionListeners()
      Returns:
      Since:
      2.0.0

      Overrides:
